title: Sprinting
body: <p>Good news! The <a href="http://www.theregister.co.uk/2005/06/06/fitness_research/" title="Sprinting for seconds better than jogging">workout that I'll plan out but never do has just gotten shorter</a>. In high-school we had a similar workout we called "<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High-intensity_interval_training">intervals</a>".  We would run them for anywhere between 100m and a mile. A 30 second one would be usually less than 200m (based on the ability of the sprinter of course), and weren't too bad, but the mile ones (about 6min for a slow-poke like me) were gut wrenching by the time you were on the last few.</p>
